page.title: 02A169,Bluebank to Pen Howe.P2
page.content:
Southbound from Sleights and "the last petrol for 17 miles", the A169 makes a 1 in 5 ascent to the{Bluebank}top car park and a view of Whitby Abbey. The road then continues straight across the moor to the{Bronze Age burial site {Pen Howe,}and the junction of the A169 with the road to Grosmont.
This is the{heather dominated upland} section where black-faced sheep can sometimes be seen grazing in peril at the road side verge.
Cleared by snowploughs in the winter blizzards but thronging with traffic in the summer sun, the A169 is for residents and visitors alike,{a {vitally important route}between Whitby and the Vale of Pickering.
